title: Test
yAxis: Ratio of government expenditure to GDP
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall Ratio of government expenditure to GDP has decreased over the Year.

Ratio of government expenditure to GDP is roughly constant from 2014 to 2016, gradually decreasing from 2016 to 2017, roughly constant from 2017 to 2019, slightly decreasing from 2019 to 2020, and lastly roughly constant from 2020 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2016 and 2017.
Max Ratio of government expenditure to GDP about 27.97 was recorded at Year 2014
Min Ratio of government expenditure to GDP about 24.67 was recorded at Year 2021
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 2 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2021.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2021 to 2024.
